result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua A. Mcgarry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joshua A. Mcgarry is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joshua A. Mcgarry was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Joshua A. Mcgarry in court with attorney Gary Stephen Dodge.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Called at 2:28pm  Plea agreement, plea to Ct 3, withheld sentence, probation.  Victim rights have been complied with.  ADA, Laufenberg has met with victim.  Def and counsel agree with plea agreement.  Plea advisement form reviewed with def.  Ct 3 - No contest plea entered.  Dismissed outright Ct 1, 2 & 4 consistent with plea agreement.  Constitutional rights, right to jury trial and elements reviewed.   Court finds def understands charge, penalties and rights.  Factual basis for plea.  Court will accept plea, found guilty of misdemeanor battery.  Sentencing arguments by Atty Bayne-Allison.  Statement by Atty Dodge.  Nothing by def.  Sentencing remarks by court.  Court orders Sentence withheld 1 yr probation AODA and follow through with all recommendations.  Court cost plus DNA surcharge and sample.  Credit of 3 days if revoked    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Post conviction rights.
Waiver of Prelim on November 10, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Gary Stephen Dodge in court.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 4:26 p.m. Def does not appear. Court will reschedule. Atty Dodge to notice Defendant - must appear.  Waiver of Prelim scheduled for November 4, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Waiver of Prelim on September 21, 2016 at 03:45 pm.

Final pre-trial on November 14, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Jury trial on December 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on August 8, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Joshua A. Mcgarry in court with attorney Gary Stephen Dodge.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Called at 2:16 pm  Complaint received, reviewed.  Waive time limits for preliminary hearing.  Bond has been set.  Court explains right to timely preliminary.  Def waives time limits.   Bond will continue with conditions  Status conference scheduled for May 2, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
